content: the v-eekender scarf/shawlette ©kimberly slifer 2014 all rights reserved i would like to give a great big thank you to all the hookers who so kindly gave their time to help me test this pattern and work out the kinks beth javner-spaulding nancy bartlett sue lock clair martin rachael taylor cyndi widrick melissa cash and last but not least dedri uys dedri you are a godsend and a crochet goddess and i thank you from the bottom of my heart materials  approximately 360yds light worsted/ worsted weight yarn  5- 6mm hook  crochet thread optional  49 beads optional - i used 4mm bicones but you can use any style or size you like as long as you can get them on your crochet thread stitches /abbreviations  double_crochet- double_crochet  single_crochet- single_crochet  chain- chain  space- space  st- stitch  v_stitch- double_crochet chain 1 double_crochet in same stitch/space  v_stitch in v_stitch- v_stitch goes in the chain 1 space of the v_stitch from the previous round  corner- vst chain 2 vst  picot- chain 3 slip_stitch in 3rd chain from the hook stitch marker using the stitch marker is optional this pinpoints where the corner of the scarf is and one of the spots where you will be increasing once you get a few rounds in to the pattern you may not need it but if it makes it easier for you it will always go in the chain 2 corner space if after round 26 you wish to continue and make your scarf/shawlette bigger just keep repeating rounds 21 and 22 just make sure you end on an even round as you will need an even number of spaces for the border to work correctly instructions round 1- chain 6 double_crochet in 5th chain from the hook v st ch2 2 v st s all in the last chain turn place your stitch marker in the chain-2 space from here on out the v st chain-2 v st will be known as the corner round 2- chain 4 this counts as a double_crochet and chain 1 throughout the entire pattern v st in v st v st in next v st make a corner in the chain-2 space v st in next v st v st chain 1 double_crochet in last v st turn round 3- chain 4 v st in first chain 1 space v st in each of the next 3 v st s make a corner in chain-2 space v st in each of the next 3 v st s v st chain 1 double_crochet in last chain-1 space turn round 4- chain 4 v st in first chain 1 space v st in each of the next 5 v st s make a corner in chain-2 space v st in each of the next 5 v st s v st chain 1 double_crochet in last chain 1 space turn round 5 thru 20- repeat round 4 with your v
